qas.question: What is anthropology a study of?
What type of anthropology describes the workings of societies around the world?
What investigates the influence of language in social life?
What subdivision of anthropology concerns itself with the long-term development of the human organism?
Where is Archaeology considered a branch of anthropology?
What is the study of human history?
What are the main subdivisions of history?
What studies the influence of societies on social life?
what studies the influince of other organisms on humans?
What does the United States view as a discipline in its own right?

context: <b5_0>Anthropology<b5_0/> is the study of <a0_0>humans and their societies<a0_0/> in the past and present. Its main subdivisions are <a1_0><b6_0><b7_0>social<a1_0/> anthropology<b7_0/> and cultural anthropology<b6_0/>, which describes the workings of societies around the world, <a2_0>linguistic anthropology<a2_0/>, which investigates the influence of language in social life, and <b8_0>biological or <a3_0>physical<a3_0/> anthropology<b8_0/>, which concerns long-term development of the human organism. <b9_0>Archaeology<b9_0/>, which studies past human cultures through investigation of physical evidence, is thought of as a branch of anthropology in the <a4_0>United States<a4_0/>, while in Europe, it is viewed as a discipline in its own right, or grouped under other related disciplines such as history.
